explanation: Agent A is correct. In the function pos is only used for read-only access (inspecting kind, sizes, header/value pointers and traversing the next link) and there are no writes to the pointed-to structure via pos. Declaring pos as a pointer-to-const (const struct MHD_HTTP_Res_Header *pos) would be valid: assigning c->rp.response->first_header (a non-const pointer) to a const-qualified pointer and doing pos = pos->next are allowed (qualification is being added, not removed), and memcpy is used with pos->header/pos->value as sources (memcpy takes const void *src), so no incompatibility is introduced. Therefore the current declaration (struct MHD_HTTP_Res_Header *pos) does violate MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13; it should be changed to const struct MHD_HTTP_Res_Header *pos when possible.
